content: this text is an introduction to international economics for upperlevel undergraduates and above the first half examines the causes and effects of international trade how tariffs and other trade policies affect the gains from trade and the ways in which governments try collectively to regulate those policies the second half deals with monetary mattersthe behavior of exchange rates how trade and capital flows affect the functioning of monetary and fiscal policies the causes and management of currency crises and the new european monetary union this fourth edition assesses the outcome of the uruguay round of trade negotiations the work of the new world trade organization wto and the challenges posed by regional trade blocs a problem set follows each chapter
title: the international economy
